annotations.description: According to the statistics, the match was pretty entertaining. There were plenty of thrilling moments. The home side were dominant and dictated the tempo of the game. The home team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession. The away side's tactic was counter attacking.

annotations.label: whistle

Anderlecht are showing great team chemistry. They are passing the ball around seamlessly.

annotations.label: time

annotations.label: substitution

Referee Alberto Undiano Mallenco sees the trip by Olivier Deschacht (Anderlecht) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. Dortmund are given an advantage. They have a free kick.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Shinji Kagawa walks off.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Anthony Vanden Borre sends a superb cross into the box. Aleksandar Mitrovic (Anderlecht) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the top left corner, leaving Mitchell Langerak beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) takes the ball, nicely zig zags through the defence, but his shot to the left post is smartly dealt with by Silvio Proto.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) swings in the corner, but it's comfortably cleared away.

Aleksandar Mitrovic (Anderlecht) takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's not a big threat for the goalkeeper as his effort is blocked by a defender. The referee points to the corner flag and Anderlecht will take a corner.
Anderlecht string together a series of short passes.

What a big chance! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up an inch perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Alberto Undiano Mallenco has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Here comes a substitution. Tired Ibrahima Conte (Anderlecht) left the pitch, and Cyriac Gohi Bi (Anderlecht) is coming on to help his team.
Erik Durm (Dortmund) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.
Frank Acheampong (Anderlecht) delivers a long ball, but it lacks enough power to reach his teammates and is intercepted by one of the defenders.

Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) attempted to send a defence splitting pass into space where Pierre Emerick Aubameyang was lurking. It could have put him one on one with the goalkeeper, but one of the defending players somehow manages to avert the threat.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee allows time for a substitution. Marcel Schmelzer will be replaced by Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
One of the defenders reacts at the last minute to brilliantly block a pass from Frank Acheampong (Anderlecht).

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) slides a pass forward, but one of the defenders cuts it out.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) picks up the rebound just outside the box and releases a weak shot straight at the goalkeeper who saves.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The resulting corner, taken by Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund), comes to nothing.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the top left corner, but is denied by a reflex save from Silvio Proto. Good work from Dortmund as they win a corner.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) wriggles into space inside the box with excellent ball control, but his effort on goal is well blocked.

annotations.label: substitution

Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Today's match ends for Ilkay Gundogan who will be replaced by Oliver Kirch (Dortmund).
Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Aleksandar Mitrovic (Anderlecht), whose header goes wide of the goal. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
Alberto Undiano Mallenco interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund).
Olivier Deschacht (Anderlecht) makes an overly aggressive challenge and Alberto Undiano Mallenco blows his whistle for a foul.
Leander Dendoncker (Anderlecht) handled the ball and gives away a free kick.

Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball into the stands. Nice run, but poor finish! The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball inside the right post.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack.
Ibrahima Conte (Anderlecht) sends over a free kick from long range but the defence is alert.
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) commits an ugly tackle on his opponent, but there is no caution from the referee.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away.
Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) releases a low pass from just outside the box in an attempt to find his teammate, but one of the defenders calmly averts the threat.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the middle of the goal. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Silvio Proto pulls off an easy save.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) passes the ball and slows down the tempo so his team can continue with their combination play.

It's a weak and poor shot by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund) as he flashes a first time shot from the edge of the box. The ball flies well wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.
Dortmund keep possession of the ball with some short passes, waiting for the moment to hit the opposition swiftly on the break.
The referee blows his whistle as Neven Subotic (Dortmund) was too aggressive in his challenge.
The ball is cleared after Ilkay Gundogan (Dortmund) attempted to dribble past an opposing player.
Alberto Undiano Mallenco blows his whistle for a foul after Ibrahima Conte (Anderlecht) hacks down one of his opponents.

What an amazing save by Silvio Proto! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.

A precise low pass is received by Ciro Immobile (Dortmund), who makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box, but his poorly placed shot sails well wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Anderlecht.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Anderlecht.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) nearly creates a chance, but his attempt to pick out a teammate with a through ball does not come off.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The second half gets underway.

The fans must be pleased so far with the entertainment on the pitch. Let's hope the players don't lose their passion and determination during the half time break. The visitors played second fiddle to the home team in the first half. Pass and move. The home side have played some possession football so far, while the visitors have been patient as they wait for the right moment to hit them on the break.

Erik Durm (Dortmund) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.

Erik Durm (Dortmund) gets the ball from a rebound and shoots from long range, but sends the ball miles wide of the left post. The goalkeeper doesn't have to worry about this one. Very poor attempt. The ball goes out of play and Anderlecht will have a goal kick.

This was a piece of cake for Silvio Proto. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
